message: Educational and Financial Opportunities for Farmworkers and Limited Resource Minority & Women producers:  The Mississippi Delta Council for Farm Workers Opportunities, Inc. (MDCFWOI) is offering two excellent programs for both Farmworkers and Limited Resource Minority & Women producers:  Farmworker Program:  seasonal and migrant Farmworkers from across the State of Mississippi can enroll in classes offered two-days per week for up to 12 weeks.  Educational opportunities and other incentives will be offered to farmworkers and their family members.  Limited Resource Minority & Women producers under the Beginner Farmers & Ranchers Program (BFRP) in Bolivar, Coahoma, Panola, Leflore, Quitman, Tallahatchie and Tunica counties can apply for mini-grants up to $500.00.  Farmworkers may also apply for the mini-grant.    Application and Orientation:  Tuesday, January 24th at 5:30 p.m. and Thursday, January 26th at 10:00 A.M. at the Mississippi Farmworkers Warehouse, 1536 Desoto Ave., Clarksdale, MS.  For more information, you may call 662-627-1121 or 662-326-0272.

Today’s announcement that 14 million additional Americans will go without healthcare coverage by 2018 due to Trumpcare should not come as a surprise.  Donald Trump and his Republican colleagues negotiated this bill in secret without input from Democrats and industry experts.  Donald Trump’s only goal is to score political points, even at the expense of hard-working Americans who deserve healthcare.  If Republicans truly want to improve our healthcare system, they should work with Democrats to make the necessary adjustments to existing law.   To read the non-partisan Congressional Budget Office's analysis, please click the below link.  https://www.cbo.gov/publication/52486

My Mound Bayou office field representative, Geri Adams presenting community service certificates to city and county employees during the 2017 National Mayor and County Official's Day Recognition Program. Proud to be participating in #DCShadowDay at the end of the month with Amy Anderson, a (fmr.) foster youth from Vicksburg,Mississippi.

Yesterday, I was shadowed by Amy Anderson, a foster parent from Vicksburg, Mississippi in recognition of National Foster Care Month.  We discussed several issues plaguing the foster care system.  Also Amy got a first-hand view of the legislative process. I think Shadow Day is an awesome way to build confidence and leadership ability.

My thoughts and prayers are with the Members of Congress, Congressional Staff, and the  United States Capitol Police impacted by this morning’s shooting.  I appreciate the heroic actions of the U.S. Capitol Police and the first responders who were on the scene.

Today, I stood beside House Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi, at a press conference, to announce plans to establish a task force with the mission of investigating possible threats on our electoral process. I encourage all of my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to join me in this effort.

It's #HBCUWeek! All week long, I will be highlighting some of the great things the HBCUs in Mississippi's Second Congressional District have accomplished! This week will be dedicated to celebrating these historic institutions while bringing awareness to the challenges they face.  Please join me in #HBCUWeek by taking to Twitter, Facebook and Instagram showing off your HBCU pride! Don't forget to tag me in your posts. I want to see how our HBCUs have and will always benefit the lives of millions!
Come out tomorrow to the #ChildCareMatters Town Hall in Greenville to learn about changes in Mississippi's Child Care Payment Program!
I am always supporting all of the #MS02 HBCUs! These three are showcased in my Washington office. #HBCUWeek

Hurricane response jobs at the U.S. SBA  The U.S. Small Business Administration is hiring temporary employees to assist with disaster relief efforts this hurricane season from September 1st to December 31st, 2017. Bilingual language skills a plus.  https://www.sba.gov/disaster-assistance/hurricane-response-jobs-sba?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery  • Damage Verifiers • Lawyers, Paralegals and Legal Assistants • Loan Specialists • Program Support Assistant and Call Center Specialist • Customer Service Representatives and Public Information Officers • Customer Service Representatives • Customer Service Representatives, Bilingual • Information Technology Specialists (Customer support) • Construction Analysts (Loss Verifiers) • Administrative Support Assistants  Disaster Response Contracts: https://www.sba.gov/disaster-assistance/disaster-response-contracts

Mississippi Development  Authority host the Model Contractors Development Program. This program is a Free- 8 Week (1 day a week) Program to show contractors how to position themselves to do business with federal, state, or local governments. It is held at the Greenville Higher Education Center, Greenville, MS. Congressman Bennie G. Thompson- Honorary Co-Host

Today, we celebrate the centennial birthday of a Mississippi civil rights icon, Mrs. Fannie Lou Hamer. Her bravery and dedication to ensure equal voting rights for all African-Americans continues to live on. We will forever honor her name. #FannieLou100
As we celebrate Mrs. Fannie Lou Hamer's 100th birthday, let's honor her by continuing to fight for equality for all people. #FannieLou100
